SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class InitGameManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.GameManager
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.InitGameManager
public class InitGameManager extends GameManager
The game manager class responsible for initializing the game state and managing the initial game flow.
It extends the abstract class GameManager and implements specific game-related methods.
This class initializes the personal goals and common goals decks, registers players, and sets up the game state.
Since:
28/04/2023
Version:
2.0
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi

    Sets up listeners for the specified player.Listeners are registered on other players' virtual views, bookshelves, and point players to listen for relevant updates.

    registerInternalListener(Player player)
    Registers the internal listeners for the specified player.
    void
    registerPlayer(ClientInterface view, String nickname)
    Registers a player in the game. If the player is already registered but disconnected, their state is updated to connected. If the player is new, they are added to the player list and their state is set to connected. Personal goals are assigned to players, and if the number of registered players matches the expected number of players, the game state transitions to MID and initializes the game board and the common goals.
    void

    This method does not perform any action and simply returns.

  • Method Details

    • initPersonalGoals

      private void initPersonalGoals() throws FileNotFoundException, URISyntaxException
      Initializes the personal goals deck by reading personal goal configuration files from a specified folder.Each file represents a personal goal, and its name (without the extension) is used as the goal's identifier. Files ending with "map.json" are excluded from the deck.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the personal goal configuration folder cannot be found
      URISyntaxException
      See Also:
      • PersonalGoal

    • initCommonGoals

      private void initCommonGoals()
      Initializes the common goals deck by retrieving the common goals from a deserializer class. The scoring tokens for each common goal are added based on the number of players in the game.
      See Also:
      • CommonGoalDeserializer
      • CommonGoal

    • dragTilesToBookShelf

      public void dragTilesToBookShelf(ClientInterface view, List<Coordinate> chosenTiles, int chosenColumn)
      This method is not applicable in the INIT state. Prints an error message indicating that the dragTilesToBookShelf method was called in the wrong state.
      Specified by:
      dragTilesToBookShelf in class GameManager
      Parameters:
      view - the ClientInterface view of the player.
      chosenTiles - the list of chosen tile coordinates.
      chosenColumn - the chosen column index.
      See Also:
      • GameManager.dragTilesToBookShelf(ClientInterface, List, int)

    • registerPlayer

      public void registerPlayer(ClientInterface view, String nickname)
      Registers a player in the game.
      • If the player is already registered but disconnected, their state is updated to connected.
      • If the player is new, they are added to the player list and their state is set to connected.
      Personal goals are assigned to players, and if the number of registered players matches the expected number of players, the game state transitions to MID and initializes the game board and the common goals.
      Specified by:
      registerPlayer in class GameManager
      Parameters:
      view - the view of the player.
      nickname - the nickname of the player.
      See Also:
      • GameManager.registerPlayer(ClientInterface, String)
      • CommonGoal
      • PersonalGoal
      • State
      • GameState
      • Player

    • setNextCurrentPlayer

      public void setNextCurrentPlayer()
      This method does not perform any action and simply returns.

    • registerInternalListener

      private void registerInternalListener(Player player)
      Registers the internal listeners for the specified player. Internal listeners are set on various game components to listen for updates and notify the player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for which to register the internal listeners.
      See Also:
      • Player

    • listenersSetUp

      private void listenersSetUp(Player player)
      Sets up listeners for the specified player.Listeners are registered on other players' virtual views, bookshelves, and point players to listen for relevant updates.
      Parameters:
      player - The player for which to set up listeners.
